p: Seasonal influenza is an acute respiratory infection caused by influenza viruses that circulate the world [ 27]. Influenza A and B viruses cause seasonal epidemics of disease. Currently circulating in humans are subtype A(H1N1) and A(H3N2) influenza viruses [ 28]. Influenza viruses circulating in animals, e.g., birds, pose threats to human health in that they can develop the ability to infect humans and cause illness [ 29]. In patients with influenza pneumonia, multiple cell types, including epithelial cells, alveolar cells, and monocytes, are infected by the influenza virus and contribute to direct cytopathogenic and inflammatory damage to the lung [ 30, 31]. In our in vitro study, in addition to the commonly used MDCK cells, we tested the antiviral effect of EEC against a panel of influenza viruses on the epithelial A549 cells and monocytic U937 cells. However, the efficacy of EEC is not as good as oseltamivir (data not shown), but comparable to that of ribavirin ( Figure S1).
